data.text:
@DNAchicky @GovNedLamont The backlog of 45k tests was from March/April 2021, when the positivity rate was pretty consistent to what it is now, if not higher.

If that backlog was driving positivity rate down, then it would be because the positivity rate of those tests was less than 2.8%.

@GovNedLamont Notice all the Covid emergency actions like you can’t be evicted.  They can’t shut your power off. And so on have ended long ago.  But for Ned. The plandemic rages on.  He needs his nazi powers to remain.  Just in case 🥴

@GovNedLamont When I first checked the update page yesterday, there was an additional sentence explaining that the 45k backlogged tests had a 6% positivity rate and accounted for about 3k positives. They must have realized that made no sense and removed that line.

@DNAchicky @GovNedLamont So now science girl doesn't like the numbers that Ole nanny Neddy is putting out there? Science is all about facts isn't it? The numbers posted are for more than one day, so the number will be 2x higher. Also the positivity rate will never hit zero due to false positives.
@Holly2360 @GovNedLamont Restrictions like visiting your own child in the nicu can require every other day
@WendyWendyfio @GovNedLamont 99% of those who type in all caps work a dead end job.
@SuupaCooper @GovNedLamont Millions of people in the Ukraine are now homeless and thousands have been become orphans and you’re complaining about paying ten cents for a bag.
